description: Fixed critical recall bug via TDD: recall(limit=N) was returning N OLDEST memories instead of N NEWEST. Root cause: recall_memories() sorted chronologically then truncated, keeping oldest entries. Fix: reverse BEFORE truncate to keep newest, then reverse back. Added test test_recall_memories_returns_most_recent_with_limit with 5 memories, verifying limit=3 returns [memory_2, memory_3, memory_4] not [memory_0, memory_1, memory_2]. All 74 memory tests pass. Bug exposed when user's /recall 30m returned Nov 9 memories instead of today's 2 newest checkpoints.
